reviews.review_msg: good professor with interesting content in this class, good bsci course if not strong at math/science

This is a class of discussions and not much learning in the traditional sense. There is no textbook, just weekly readings. The topics are relevant to the class and he fosters a good discussion environment in class. Asks for 2 essays over the semester and will provide good feedback on your proposals. Good class for science and engineering students.

Pol 150 was definitely an interesting class! If you put time and effort into the weekly readings, and keep up to date on lectures, you'll be fine! In saying that, readings are defiantly heavy.. and theres a lot of them. At one point we had 200 pages per week. Two large papers make up your grade in the course, so take time on it!
The reading was a little heavy, but you learn so much! He is a great prof and makes classes really interactive and engaging.

Not sure why this prof is getting so much negative feedback when I have had the best experience with her. This class was difficult as POL is not my major but I am so glad I took it with Linda. Yes, her instructions are 6 pages sometimes but she is so detailed and helpful. Even gave us the option to submit an answer for the final to get feedback.

This class was a disaster and a mess, do not take any classes with her if you can avoid it. Long and confusing instructions and never give any grade and feedback to you until the semester end. She can not even post the homework on time. She told you this is an A grade assignment and somehow give you a B at the end. Just do not take her class!!

4 weeks late on lecture material. Still forced us to be examined on the material she wasn't able to cover. Left assignments unmarked and only provided our assignment marks AFTER the exam was over. This left little room for improvement prior to the exam. Comments on essays do not correspond with grade received. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
